NVIDIA Budget Blackwell Released 2025-08-15

NVIDIA GeForce RTX 5060

The most affordable Blackwell GPU brings DLSS 4 and ray tracing to the sub-$300 segment. With 8GB GDDR7 and efficient power draw, it's the entry ticket to current-gen gaming technology.

Frequently Asked Questions

Is the NVIDIA GeForce RTX 5060 good for gaming?

The NVIDIA GeForce RTX 5060 scores 65/100 at 1080p, 55/100 at 1440p, and 35/100 at 4K in our gaming benchmarks. It is best suited for budget gaming builds and esports gaming.

What is the price of the NVIDIA GeForce RTX 5060?

The NVIDIA GeForce RTX 5060 has an MSRP of $299 and is currently available for approximately $309.

How much VRAM does the NVIDIA GeForce RTX 5060 have?

The NVIDIA GeForce RTX 5060 has 8GB of GDDR7 memory on a 128-bit memory bus, providing adequate memory for 1080p gaming and everyday use.

What power supply do I need for the NVIDIA GeForce RTX 5060?

The NVIDIA GeForce RTX 5060 has a TDP of 150W. We recommend a minimum 500W power supply. It uses a 1x 8-pin power connector.
